title: Kristi Noem
deleted: Noem has received 26 traffic citations, including 20 [[Speeding ticket|speeding tickets]] from 1989 to 2010,<ref>{{Cite news |last=Yingling |first=Jennifer |date=August 27, 2010 |title='Please pull over': GOP candidate has 26 traffic violations |url=https://thehill.com/blogs/in-the-know/in-the-know/254343-please-pull-over-gop-candidate-has-26-traffic-violations |access-date=November 16, 2020 |newspaper=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]] |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193332/https://thehill.com/blogs/in-the-know/in-the-know/254343-please-pull-over-gop-candidate-has-26-traffic-violations |url-status=live}}</ref> stop sign and seat belt violations, no driver's license, [[failure to appear]] notices, and two [[Arrest warrant|arrest warrants]]. She has said, "I'm not proud of my driving record, but [I've] been working hard to be a better example to young kids and young drivers out there." She has paid her fines and penalties.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Woster |first=Kevin |title=Life in the too-fast lane: Noem traffic shows long list of tickets |url=https://rapidcityjournal.com/news/life-in-the-too-fast-lane-noem-traffic-shows-long-list-of-tickets/article_5fdda8ca-b18a-11df-8518-001cc4c002e0.html |date=August 27, 2010 |access-date=November 16, 2020 |website=[[Rapid City Journal]] |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193323/https://rapidcityjournal.com/news/life-in-the-too-fast-lane-noem-traffic-shows-long-list-of-tickets/article_5fdda8ca-b18a-11df-8518-001cc4c002e0.html |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=Noem's driving record takes wheel of campaign|url=https://www.mitchellrepublic.com/news/government-and-politics/1528437-noems-driving-record-takes-wheel-campaign|access-date=November 16, 2020|website=The Mitchell Republic|archive-date=November 16, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193422/https://www.mitchellrepublic.com/news/government-and-politics/1528437-noems-driving-record-takes-wheel-campaign|url-status=live}}</ref>

title: Kristi Noem
added: In February 2021, Noem signed a bill limiting civil liability for certain exposures to COVID-19.  The bill exempted health care providers and other businesses to include those selling personal protective equipment from lawsuits unless COVID-19 exposure was the result of gross negligence, recklessness, or willful misconduct.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Nelson |first1=Darsha |title=Noem signs bill limiting liability for certain COVID-19 exposures |url=https://www.newscenter1.tv/noem-signs-bill-limiting-liability-for-certain-covid-19-exposures/ |website=Newscenter1 |access-date=22 February 2021}}</ref>

title: Kristi Noem
added: In February 2021, Noem signed a bill limiting civil liability for certain exposures to COVID-19. title: Kristi Noem
deleted: Noem did not mandate social distancing or the [[Face masks during the COVID-19 pandemic|wearing of face masks]] at a July 3 event at [[Mount Rushmore]] that featured Trump. Health experts warned that large gatherings without social distancing or mask-wearing posed a risk to public health.<ref name="auto">{{Cite news |last=Cummings |first=William |title='We won't be social distancing' at Mount Rushmore celebration with Trump, says SD Gov. Noem |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2020/07/01/kristi-noem-social-distancing-mount-rushmore-trump/5354257002/ |access-date=July 3, 2020 |newspaper=USA Today |date=July 1, 2020 |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193236/https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2020/07/01/kristi-noem-social-distancing-mount-rushmore-trump/5354257002/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Noem doubted scientific recommendations on the usefulness of masks in slowing the transmission of COVID-19.<ref name="good">{{Cite news |date=October 22, 2020 |title=Noem says South Dakota is doing 'good' as virus surges |url=https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-health-south-dakota-f967a1a56b798f43ae0d2be971b27b39 |access-date=October 24, 2020 |website=AP News |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193231/https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-health-south-dakota-f967a1a56b798f43ae0d2be971b27b39 |url-status=live}}</ref> In an opinion piece in the ''[[Rapid City Journal]]'', she defended her views, citing analysis by the [[Association of American Physicians and Surgeons]], a group known for promoting pseudoscience.<ref name="good" />

title: Kristi Noem
deleted: During the [[COVID-19 pandemic in South Dakota]], Noem took a hands-off approach.<ref name="ad" /> She did not implement face mask mandates, frequently raised doubts about the efficacy of mask-wearing, encouraged large gatherings without social distancing or mask-wearing, and rejected public health experts' advice.<ref name="amid">{{Cite news |last=Nauman |first=Talli |date=2020-11-23 |title=South Dakota gripped by pandemic amid Kristi Noem's no-mask approach |url=http://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/nov/23/south-dakota-gripped-by-pandemic-amid-kristi-noem-no-mask-approach |access-date=2021-01-01 |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |language=en}}</ref><ref name="denial">{{Cite news |first=Ed |last=Pilkington |date=2020-11-19 |title=Kristi Noem rigidly follows Trump strategy of denial as Covid ravages South Dakota |url=http://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/nov/19/kristi-noem-trump-strategy-denial-covid-ravages-south-dakota |access-date=2021-01-01 |newspaper=The Guardian |language=en}}</ref> As of December 2020, she was one of few governors who had not issued statewide [[stay-at-home orders]] or face-mask mandates.<ref name="AP200505" /><ref name="ABC201116">{{Cite news |last=Groves |first=Stephen |agency=[[Associated Press]] |title=As deaths spiral, South Dakota governor opposes mask rules |url=https://abcnews.go.com/Health/wireStory/deaths-spiral-south-dakota-governor-opposes-mask-rules-74240852 |access-date=2021-01-01 |date=November 16, 2020 |work=ABC News |language=en}}</ref> Media sources has indicated that Noem's response mirrored President [[Donald Trump]]'s highly criticized rhetoric about and handling of [[COVID-19]].<ref name="denial" /><ref name="AP200806">{{Cite news |last=Groves |first=Stephen |agency=[[Associated Press]] |date=2020-08-26 |title=South Dakota's Noem speaks at RNC as state virus cases rise |url=https://apnews.com/article/cbcc0233d22afd899d8a07c67ad859bd |access-date=2021-01-01 |website=AP News}}</ref> Noem spoke at the August [[2020 Republican National Convention]], which elevated her national profile.<ref name="AP200806" /><ref name="PBS200826">{{Cite news |date=2020-08-26 |title=WATCH: South Dakota Gov. Kristi Noem paints dark picture of U.S. under Dem leaders |url=https://www.pbs.org/newshour/politics/watch-south-dakota-gov-kristi-noem-paints-dark-picture-of-u-s-under-dem-leaders |access-date=2021-01-01 |work=PBS NewsHour |language=en-us}}</ref>

She has said, "I'm not proud of my driving record, but [I've] been working hard to be a better example to young kids and young drivers out there." She has paid her fines and penalties.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Woster |first=Kevin |title=Life in the too-fast lane: Noem traffic shows long list of tickets |url=https://rapidcityjournal.com/news/life-in-the-too-fast-lane-noem-traffic-shows-long-list-of-tickets/article_5fdda8ca-b18a-11df-8518-001cc4c002e0.html |date=August 27, 2010 |access-date=November 16, 2020 |website=[[Rapid City Journal]] |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193323/https://rapidcityjournal.com/news/life-in-the-too-fast-lane-noem-traffic-shows-long-list-of-tickets/article_5fdda8ca-b18a-11df-8518-001cc4c002e0.html |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=Noem's driving record takes wheel of campaign|url=https://www.mitchellrepublic.com/news/government-and-politics/1528437-noems-driving-record-takes-wheel-campaign|access-date=November 16, 2020|website=The Mitchell Republic|archive-date=November 16, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193422/https://www.mitchellrepublic.com/news/government-and-politics/1528437-noems-driving-record-takes-wheel-campaign|url-status=live}}</ref>

title: Kristi Noem
deleted: During the [[COVID-19 pandemic in South Dakota]], Noem took a hands-off approach.<ref name="ad">{{Cite news |title=South Dakota governor uses coronavirus relief funds for $5 million tourism ad despite COVID surge |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/kristi-noem-south-dakota-coronavirus-relief-funds-tourism/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193232/https://www.cbsnews.com/news/kristi-noem-south-dakota-coronavirus-relief-funds-tourism/ |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |access-date=September 10, 2020 |work=CBS News}}</ref> She did not implement face mask mandates, frequently raised doubts about the efficacy of mask-wearing, encouraged large gatherings without social distancing or mask-wearing, and rejected the advice of public health experts.<ref name="amid">{{Cite news|last=Nauman|first=Talli|date=2020-11-23|title=South Dakota gripped by pandemic amid Kristi Noem's no-mask approach|language=en|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|url=http://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/nov/23/south-dakota-gripped-by-pandemic-amid-kristi-noem-no-mask-approach|access-date=2021-01-01}}</ref><ref Guardian|url=http://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/nov/19/kristi-noem-trump-strategy-denial-covid-ravages-south-dakota|access-date=2021-01-01}}</ref> As of December 2020, she was one of few governors who had not issued statewide [[stay-at-home orders]] or face-mask mandates.<ref name="AP200505">{{cite news |last1=Beaumont |first1=Thomas |last2=Groves |first2=Stephen |title='A resume for future office': Virus tests a GOP governor |url=https://apnews.com/5fd99698995959a4ac3fe88625732367 |date=May 5, 2020 |work=AP News |agency=[[Associated Press]] |access-date=May 5, 2020 |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193240/https://apnews.com/5fd99698995959a4ac3fe88625732367 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="ABC201116">{{Cite news|last=Groves|first=Stephen|date=November 16, 2020|title=As deaths spiral, South Dakota governor opposes mask rules|language=en|work=ABC News|agency=[[Associated Press]]|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Health/wireStory/deaths-spiral-south-dakota-governor-opposes-mask-rules-74240852|access-date=2021-01-01}}</ref> Her response mirrored Trump's rhetoric and handling of COVID-19.<ref name="denial" /><ref name="AP200806">{{Cite news|last=Groves|first=Stephen|date=2020-08-26|title=South Dakota's Noem speaks at RNC as state virus cases rise|website=AP News|agency=[[Associated Press]]|url=https://apnews.com/article/cbcc0233d22afd899d8a07c67ad859bd|access-date=2021-01-01}}</ref> She was rewarded for her COVID-19 response with a speech at the August [[2020 Republican National Convention]], which elevated her national profile.<ref name="AP200806" /><ref name="PBS200826">{{Cite news|date=2020-08-26|title=WATCH: South Dakota Gov. Kristi Noem paints dark picture of U.S. under Dem leaders|language=en-us|work=PBS NewsHour|url=https://www.pbs.org/newshour/politics/watch-south-dakota-gov-kristi-noem-paints-dark-picture-of-u-s-under-dem-leaders|access-date=2021-01-01}}</ref> The ''Argus Leader'' described the RNC speech as a "defining moment in her political career."<ref>{{Cite web|last=Kaczke|first=Lisa|title=Gov. Kristi Noem lauds Trump, ignores coronavirus in RNC speech|url=https://www.argusleader.com/story/news/politics/2020/08/26/kristi-noem-president-donald-trump-republican-national-convention-speech/3442124001/|access-date=2021-01-01|website=Argus Leader|language=en-US}}</ref>

Early in the pandemic, she emphasized her state's role in evaluating [[hydroxychloroquine]], an [[antimalarial drug]] of unproven efficacy in treating COVID-19 that Trump had touted.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/14/politics/south-dakota-governor-kristi-noem-coronavirus/index.html |title=South Dakota governor faces criticism over refusal to issue stay-at-home order after pork plant outbreak |last=Bradner |first=Eric |date=April 14, 2020 |work=CNN |access-date=April 14, 2020 |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193234/https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/14/politics/south-dakota-governor-kristi-noem-coronavirus/index.html |url-status=live }}</ref> South Dakota had one of the largest [[COVID-19 pandemic in the United States|outbreaks in the U.S.]]<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/south-dakotas-governor-resisted-ordering-people-to-stay-home-now-it-has-one-of-the-nations-largest-coronavirus-hot-spots/2020/04/13/5cff90fe-7daf-11ea-a3ee-13e1ae0a3571_story.html |title=South Dakota's governor resisted ordering people to stay home. Now it has one of the nation's largest coronavirus hot spots. |last=Witte |first=Griff |date=April 13, 2020 |newspaper=The Washington Post |access-date=April 14, 2020 |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193234/https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/south-dakotas-governor-resisted-ordering-people-to-stay-home-now-it-has-one-of-the-nations-largest-coronavirus-hot-spots/2020/04/13/5cff90fe-7daf-11ea-a3ee-13e1ae0a3571_story.html |url-status=live }}</ref> The [[Smithfield Foods]] production plant in [[Sioux Falls, South Dakota|Sioux Falls]] had four deaths, with nearly 1,300 workers and their family members testing positive.<ref>{{Cite news |first=Trevor J. |last=Mitchell |url=https://eu.argusleader.com/story/news/2020/05/04/south-dakota-confirms-37-more-cases-covid-19/3077130001 |title=Noem 'disappointed' Smithfield isn't sharing reopening plans |date=May 4, 2020 |newspaper=[[Argus Leader]] |access-date=May 6, 2020 |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193231/https://www.argusleader.com/story/news/2020/05/04/south-dakota-confirms-37-more-cases-covid-19/3077130001/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Noem pointed out that the plant was in full operation as an essential food manufacturing facility.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://rapidcityjournal.com/news/local/state-and-regional/noem-refuses-banning-evictions-utility-shutoffs-rejects-shelter-in-place-request/article_d05d9af8-0c1d-5809-b281-2ca4ceb41cff.html |title=Noem refuses banning evictions, utility shutoffs; rejects shelter-in-place request |last=Matzen |first=Morgan |date=April 14, 2020 |newspaper=[[Rapid City Journal]] |access-date=April 16, 2020 |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193235/https://rapidcityjournal.com/news/local/state-and-regional/noem-refuses-banning-evictions-utility-shutoffs-rejects-shelter-in-place-request/article_d05d9af8-0c1d-5809-b281-2ca4ceb41cff.html |url-status=live }}</ref> Forty-eight of Smithfield's workers were hospitalized.<ref name="Salon">[https://www.salon.com/2020/09/12/is-south-dakotas-kristi-noem-a-trump-superfan-now-the-nations-worst-covid-governor/ Is South Dakota's Kristi Noem, a Trump superfan, the nation's worst COVID governor?] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193309/https://www.salon.com/2020/09/12/is-south-dakotas-kristi-noem-a-trump-superfan-now-the-nations-worst-covid-governor/ |date=November 16, 2020 }}, ''[[Salon.com]]'', Sophia Tesfaye, September 12, 2020. Retrieved September 13, 2020.</ref> On April 6, Noem issued an executive order that said people "shall" follow guidance from the [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]];<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://sdsos.gov/general-information/executive-actions/executive-orders/assets/2020-12.PDF |title=Executive Order 2020-12 |last=Noem |first=Kristi |date=April 6, 2020 |website=South Dakota Secretary of State |access-date=May 16, 2020 |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193245/https://sdsos.gov/general-information/executive-actions/executive-orders/assets/2020-12.PDF |url-status=live }}</ref> she also ordered everyone over age 65 in [[Minnehaha County, South Dakota|Minnehaha]] and [[Lincoln County, South Dakota|Lincoln]] counties to stay home for three weeks.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://sdsos.gov/general-information/executive-actions/executive-orders/assets/2020-13.PDF |title=Executive Order 2020-13 |last=Noem |first=Kristi |date=April 6, 2020 |website=South Dakota Secretary of State |access-date=May 16, 2020 |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193207/https://sdsos.gov/general-information/executive-actions/executive-orders/assets/2020-13.PDF |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.npr.org/2020/04/14/834137887/despite-outbreak-south-dakota-governor-hesitant-to-issue-stay-at-home-order |title=Despite Outbreak, South Dakota Governor Hesitant To Issue Stay-At-Home Order |last=Strubinger |first=Lee |date=April 14, 2020 |work=NPR |access-date=April 14, 2020 |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193313/https://www.npr.org/2020/04/14/834137887/despite-outbreak-south-dakota-governor-hesitant-to-issue-stay-at-home-order |url-status=live }}</ref>

Noem did not mandate social distancing or the [[Face masks during the COVID-19 pandemic|wearing of face masks]] at a July 3 event at [[Mount Rushmore]] with Trump present. Health experts warned that large gatherings without social distancing or mask-wearing posed a risk to public health.<ref name="auto">{{Cite news |last=Cummings |first=William |title='We won't be social distancing' at Mount Rushmore celebration with Trump, says SD Gov. Noem |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2020/07/01/kristi-noem-social-distancing-mount-rushmore-trump/5354257002/ |access-date=July 3, 2020 |newspaper=USA Today |date=July 1, 2020 |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193236/https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2020/07/01/kristi-noem-social-distancing-mount-rushmore-trump/5354257002/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Noem doubted scientific recommendations on the usefulness of masks in slowing the transmission of COVID-19.<ref name="good">{{Cite news |date=October 22, 2020 |title=Noem says South Dakota is doing 'good' as virus surges |url=https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-health-south-dakota-f967a1a56b798f43ae0d2be971b27b39 |access-date=October 24, 2020 |website=AP News |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193231/https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-health-south-dakota-f967a1a56b798f43ae0d2be971b27b39 |url-status=live}}</ref> In an opinion piece in the ''[[Rapid City Journal]]'', she defended her views, citing analysis by the [[Association of American Physicians and Surgeons]], a group known for promoting pseudoscience.<ref name="good" />

Sixteen weeks after Trump's executive order that provided enhanced weekly unemployment benefits of $300 as part of the [[U.S. federal government response to the COVID-19 pandemic|U.S. federal government response to the pandemic]], Noem opted out of the program, citing a low state unemployment rate.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2020/08/15/south-dakota-unemployment-trump/ |title=South Dakota declines to boost unemployment payments under Trump's order |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |first=Tony |last=Romm |date=August 15, 2020 |access-date=September 12, 2020 |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193243/https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2020/08/15/south-dakota-unemployment-trump/ |url-status=live }}</ref> South Dakota was the only state to refuse the assistance.<ref name=UI>{{cite news |last1=Luhby |first1=Tami |title=South Dakota turns down Trump's unemployment benefits boost |url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/16/politics/south-dakota-trump-unemployment-benefits/index.html |access-date=August 30, 2020 |work=CNN |date=August 16, 2020 |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193253/https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/16/politics/south-dakota-trump-unemployment-benefits/index.html |url-status=live }}</ref> Its jobless rate in June was 7.2%, up from 3.1% in March, though down from 10.9% in April.<ref name=Salon/> Acceptance of the funding required the state to augment the benefit by $100 unless other jobless assistance allowed for the match to be waived.<ref name=UI/>

South Dakota is one of two states in the U.S. to offer no emergency financial assistance to renters during the pandemic.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Rental Assistance|url=https://nlihc.org/rental-assistance|access-date=September 17, 2020|website=National Low Income Housing Coalition|archive-date=November 16, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193317/https://nlihc.org/rental-assistance|url-status=live}}</ref>

Noem supported the annual [[Sturgis Motorcycle Rally]], despite warnings from experts who argued that it could be a [[superspreading event]].<ref>{{Cite web|last=Blistein|first=Jon|date=August 12, 2020|title='Freedom-Loving People': Behind the Scenes at That Controversial Smash Mouth Show in South Dakota|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/sturgis-covid-19-biker-fest-smash-mouth-1043040/|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193238/https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/sturgis-covid-19-biker-fest-smash-mouth-1043040/|archive-date=November 16, 2020|access-date=September 12, 2020|website=[[Rolling Stone]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Burke |first1=Minyvonne |title=Sturgis motorcycle rally draws thousands of bikers despite coronavirus fears |url=https://news.yahoo.com/sturgis-motorcycle-rally-draws-thousands-164500341.html |website=news.yahoo.com |publisher=NBC News |access-date=September 12, 2020 |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193238/https://news.yahoo.com/sturgis-motorcycle-rally-draws-thousands-164500341.html |url-status=live }}</ref> Public health notices were issued for saloons and other businesses in the Sturgis area. By the end of August, dozens of cases linked to attendance at the event were reported in several states.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Todisco |first1=Eric |title=At Least 103 New Coronavirus Cases in 8 States Linked to South Dakota Motorcycle Rally |url=https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/us/at-least-103-new-coronavirus-cases-in-8-states-linked-to-south-dakota-motorcycle-rally/ar-BB18mxWw?ocid=sf |website=www.msn.com |publisher=People |access-date=September 12, 2020 |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193252/https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/us/at-least-103-new-coronavirus-cases-in-8-states-linked-to-south-dakota-motorcycle-rally/ar-BB18mxWw?ocid=sf |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|date=August 7, 2020|title=Colorado Reports 20+ Coronavirus Cases Linked To Sturgis Motorcycle Rally|url=https://www.msn.com/en-us/sports/more-sports/colorado-reports-20-coronavirus-cases-linked-to-sturgis-motorcycle-rally/ar-BB18rq0u|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193306/https://www.msn.com/en-us/sports/more-sports/colorado-reports-20-coronavirus-cases-linked-to-sturgis-motorcycle-rally/ar-BB18rq0u|archive-date=November 16, 2020|access-date=September 12, 2020|website=CBS Denver via MSN}}</ref><ref name=CasperStarTribune>{{Cite web|last1=Groves|first1=Stephen|last2=Associated Press|date=August 24, 2020|title=Revved by Sturgis Rally, COVID-19 infections move fast, far|url=https://trib.com/news/state-and-regional/revved-by-sturgis-rally-covid-19-infections-move-fast-far/article_86d17b38-af69-5e4e-bae0-4aaa5392310f.html|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193312/https://trib.com/news/state-and-regional/revved-by-sturgis-rally-covid-19-infections-move-fast-far/article_86d17b38-af69-5e4e-bae0-4aaa5392310f.html|archive-date=November 16, 2020|access-date=September 12, 2020|website=[[Casper Star-Tribune]]}}</ref>

In September, amid a surge of new cases, Noem announced that she would spend $5 million of relief funding on a state tourism campaign.<ref name="ad" /> She used $819,000 of those funds to have the state's Department of Tourism run a 30-second [[Fox News]] commercial she narrated during the 2020 Republican National Convention.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Groves |first1=Stephen |last2=Beaumont |first2=Thomas |title=South Dakota spends $819,000 on Fox News ad pitching tourism in the state |url=https://billingsgazette.com/news/state-and-regional/govt-and-politics/south-dakota-spends-819-000-on-fox-news-ad-pitching-tourism-in-the-state/article_5eb989f7-bf39-5e23-828f-43ba6326ae89.html|access-date=November 17, 2020 |work=[[The Billings Gazette]] |agency=[[Associated Press]] |date=September 3, 2020}}</ref> During September, over 550 students became infected at South Dakota universities; 200 more cases were reported in [[Kâ€“12]] schools.<ref name=Salon/>

In October, as South Dakota reported the country's second-highest number of new covid cases per capita and hospitals began to prioritize treatment of severe covid cases over lesser ones, Noem said the higher case numbers were because of more testing, despite the positive test rate and hospitalization rate also increasing.<ref>{{Cite news |date=October 13, 2020 |title=Noem blames surge in cases on testing as hospitals fill |url=https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-health-sioux-falls-south-dakota-5d28c62f4b7c7cb51e764f3ecb4e1cb5 |access-date=October 14, 2020 |website=AP News |agency=[[Associated Press]] |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193330/https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-health-sioux-falls-south-dakota-5d28c62f4b7c7cb51e764f3ecb4e1cb5 |url-status=live }}</ref>

In February 2021, Noem signed a bill limiting civil liability for certain exposures to COVID-19. The bill exempts health care providers and other businesses, including those selling personal protective equipment, from lawsuits unless COVID-19 exposure was the result of gross negligence, recklessness, or willful misconduct.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Nelson |first1=Darsha |title=Noem signs bill limiting liability for certain COVID-19 exposures |url=https://www.newscenter1.tv/noem-signs-bill-limiting-liability-for-certain-covid-19-exposures/ |website=[[KNBN|KNBN NewsCenter1]] |access-date=22 February 2021 |date=February 17, 2021}}</ref>

title: Kristi Noem
deleted: On November 18, 2019, Noem released a new [[Methamphetamine|meth]] awareness campaign named "Meth, We're on It". The campaign was widely mocked and Noem was criticized for using a Minnesota firm.<ref>{{cite news |first=Tim |last=Stelloh |title=South Dakota: 'Meth. We're on it,' and we're sticking with anti-drug slogan |url=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/south-dakota-meth-we-re-it-sticking-anti-drug-slogan-n1085366 |date=November 18, 2019 |access-date=May 14, 2020 |work=[[NBC News]] |archive-date=November 16, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201116193313/https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/south-dakota-meth-we-re-it-sticking-anti-drug-slogan-n1085366 |url-status=live }}</ref>
